720463f-a.text:
Hudson Street, north across Reade Street. At the right is West Broadway. The several low structures there are at the triangular apex formed by the convergence of these two thoroughfares. The writer believes that the photographer is standing on the "El" platform station at Chambers Street. The wooded area in the left center is the small Duane Park. Beyond appears the American Express Building at the S. W. corner of Jay Street. The opposite corner (with canopy) will become the site of the House of Relief of the New York Hospital and which later housed the present Marine Hospital.
About 1870's
H. N. Tiemann, photo
Gift of Urbrock Collection
Neg w 972
720463f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Reade Street, Manhattan, NY

720462f-a.text:
(1)
5-3 Hudson Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Reade Street. Also shown, is Reade Street, south side, west from Hudson to Greenwich Streets. This view is taken from under the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line at West Broadway.
December 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2) F6
The same, at an earlier date.
NEG # 3661
July 26, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

724372f-a.text:
(1)
An aerial view of West Broadway, east side, north from and including Reade, to, but not including Leonard Streets. The Sixth Ave., Elevated is shown on West Broadway.
February 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
February 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
